ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Type of device
Length of time over which data was collected
Notes: for example, One week, One month

ElementDescription: Average number of daily steps during period
Time (length of "driven/compulsive" exercise) in minutes
Average resting heart rate during period
Average active heart rate during period
Max number of days possible for device worn
Device worn on how many days?
Time off minute
Time off AM or PM
Explain:
Total hours worn
Average hours worn daily
Comments about assessment
Day Number
Device NOT worn
Stimulation level
Time on hour, O''clock
Time on minute
Time on AM or PM
Time off hour, O''clock
Root mean square (RMS) of successive differences between heartbeats during sleep
Whether data collected was for a week or weekday
Duration of sleep
Duration of sleep latency
Duration until the midpoint of sleep
OURA Sleep Efficiency Percentage
Notes: Determined by Oura biosensor/app; percentage of time spent asleep after going to bed compared with a generally accepted cut-off score of 85% for healthy adults

ElementDescription: Average heart rate during sleep duration
Lowest heart rate during sleep duration
Time zone of the site collecting the data
Number of hours between UTC  and local device time
Date based on UTC. The date of which data collection started
Time based on UTC. The time of which data collection started
Date based on UTC. The date of which data collection ended
Time based on UTC. The time of which data collection ended
Data file 1
type of data file 1
Passive sensor types
Notes: eg., gyroscope, accelerometer, geolocation, screen, bluetooth, wifi

ElementDescription: Temporal resolution of derived sensor measures
Name of preprocessing pipeline
Visit name
Manufacturer and model of the watch device
Daily physical activity converted into approximate meters i.e., amount of walking needed to get the same amount of activity
Total calories consumed during the entire task
Average MET (Metabolic Equivalent) level during the whole day
Notes: Oura calculates the daily energy expenditure using METs or Metabolic Equivalents.

ElementDescription: Time awake during sleep (seconds)
Time spent in deep sleep (seconds)
Time spent in light sleep (seconds)
Time spent in rem sleep (seconds)
Total number of steps registered during the day
Energy consumption caused by the physical activity of the day (kilocalories)
Timestamp of event marker press by participant
Notes: Timestamps in UTC (microseconds) of the event marks

ElementDescription: Skin temperature of the subject wearing device in degree Celsius
Device timestamp (date and time) when readings are recorded
Standard deviation of the accelerometer magnitude
Standard deviation of the accelerometer magnitude - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Actigraphy Counts X axis
Actigraphy Counts Y axis
Actigraphy Counts Z axis
Actigraphy Vector Magnitude (VM)
Notes: Vector Magnitude is the square root of the sum of the squares of each axis of data

ElementDescription: Actigraphy Counts - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Total Activity Count: Number of activity counts on the day of the interval being analyzed
Activity counts X axis
Activity counts Y axis
Activity counts Z axis
Activity counts - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Activity Intensity
Notes: 1 = Sedentary; 2 = Light physical activity; 3 = Moderate physical activity; 4 =  Vigorous physical activity

ElementDescription: Activity Intensity - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Body position if worn on left wrist
Body position if worn on right wrist
Body position - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Timestamp in UNIX format with 1 minute increments
Mean skin conductance level
Electrodermal activity - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Metabolic equivalent of task (MET)
Metabolic equivalent of task - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Root Mean Square of Successive Differences in ms
Root Mean Square of Successive Differences - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Worn with low signal quality; 2 = Worn during motion; 3 = Device not recording

ElementDescription: Pulse
Pulse - reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Worn with low signal quality; 2 = Worn during motion; 3 = Device not recording

ElementDescription: Respiratory rate (breathing per minute)
Respiratory rate - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Worn with low signal quality; 2 = Worn during motion; 3 = Device not recording

Sleep stage detected

Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Step count - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Skin temperature - Reason for missing data
Notes: 1 = Device not recording; 2 = Device not worn correctly

ElementDescription: Wearing detection percentage
Wearing detection - Reason for missing data

ElementDescription: Accelerometer y-axis (ADC count)
Accelerometer z-axis (ADC count)
Blood volume pulse

ElementDescription: Electrodermal activity
Notes: Data from the electrodermal activity sensor expressed in microsiemens (Î¼S)

ElementDescription: Number of steps taken in the sampling interval
